intro: Cnemidostachys sellowiana, commonly known as the Sellow's spider-plant, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Bromeliaceae and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves that form a water-holding basin. The plant produces striking, showy inflorescences that are often red or orange in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value. Its unique structure and ability to retain water make it well adapted to its natural habitat.
